> [{quoted}](name=Don Pavoni,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AtuQknE0,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-02-15T14:42:32.555+0000)
>
> As a luluplayer, i can tell you that kog isn't the big issue here. replace him with tris, **cait** or jinx or any other hypercarry and you got nearly the same result.

Cait is not a hypercarry. If she's a hypercarry, then so is Ashe.

She actually is.

She has immense range, good self peel, and strong AD scalings (especially post rework). She has a bit of an unorthodox power curve for a hyper carry (most are weak early, ok mid game, strong late game, where Cait is good early, weak mid game, strong late) but she is still a hyper carry.

Ashe can also be counted as a hyper carry if she gets to late game because again she is very long ranged, has great self peel, and exceptionally high damage with proper items (because of her passive and her Q she scales incredibly hard on 5-6 items, especially with the amount of crit in the game right now).

Being a hyper carry isn't all about whether you can 1v5 teams late game, it's about how strong you are at what point in the game. Tristana is also a hyper carry, but has some of the worst damage statistics of any ADC. She still counts though because she has excellent safety and tower killing power when she gets to late game.

Then EVERY adc is a hypercarry because EVERY adc reaches a peak at 6 items. A hypercarry doesn't have a specific definition, but a good rule of thumb is that even if they get destroyed early on, if the game just progresses past a certain point even if they remain behidn the enemy non-hyper carry, they will come out on top. Examples of this would be Vayne and Kog because their damage continuously scales well based on levels and enemy hp regardless of their own gold. Same thing with Kindred.

No one in this game can truly 1v5 like Anti-Mage or Faceless Void. We still have a concept of hard carry that applies to others besides marksmen though, and thus we still have a concept of a truly powerful late game carry.

A passive steroid that you cannot reliably control or press on-demand does not count. This includes Varus and Caitlyn. High ratios on Q mean nothing in a late game teamfight because you will be pumping out dps using your basic attacks. Caitlyn has some of the worst AS at all stages in the game. Pretending that you can ignore that for massive Q poke and play her like Graves is silly. And it's the ONLY 'steroid' she has. Even if you want to include the passive, _Then Varus has more than her._  _Lucian has more than her._ 

And we're back to square one: calling a hypercarry someone who peaks at the late game is ridiculous because every ADC reaches their peak in the late game.

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AtuQknE0,comment-id=0004000000020000,timestamp=2016-02-15T16:00:21.825+0000)
> And we're back to square one: calling a hypercarry someone who peaks at the late game is ridiculous because every ADC reaches their peak in the late game.

No they don't.

Some Marksmen hit their peak early game and drop off more and more the longer the game goes.  See: Corki

Some Marksmen start off weak and grow stronger the longer the game goes.  See: Vayne.

Some Marksmen are at their strongest mid game with relative drop off early and late.  See: Kog, though he's over-tuned right now.

Hyper carries require neither range nor self peel to be identified as such. A hyper carry simply has higher then average damage for their class allowing them to kill enemy team's faster than average. Vayne and Kog'Maw are too very different hyper carries. One lacks any form of peel while the other no range. Both are hyper carries due to how well they scale with items. Caitlin might have both range and safety, but she doesn't have meaningful steroids to shred a tank faster then any other adc. Ashe might be able to count with a Runaan's and q on three targets, but I believe she also doesn't have the same kind team killing as Twitch or Kog'Maw come full build.

>A hyper carry simply has higher then average damage for their class

Not true, case in point Draven and Tristana.

Draven has some of the highest damage out of all marksmen as a class, however it is undisputed that he is not a hyper carry because he has difficulty dealing damage safely late game. Tristana statistically has the worst damage per game out of almost all marksmen. The reason safety is so essential to hyper carry status is that if you aren't safe, you're dead, and if you're dead you aren't dealing damage.

In fact, safety is more determinant of a hyper carry than the damage they deal.

{{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:18}} {{champion:67}} are all the marksmen hyper carries, and of those 6, 2 have inherently massive range, 3 have major range steroids, all 6 have self peel, and 4 have mobility. The fact that they have damage steroids of varying efficacy is irrelevant, because what makes them powerful is the other tools in their kits that allow them to *use* their damage, not the damage itself.

This is news to me that Cait and Ashe are hyper carries. Back in seasons 3 and 4 people always talked about Caits weak late game as the trade off for her dominating laning phase and Ashe gets initiation power and kiting but her being hyper carry is never mentioned in most conversations. Also if Twitch is no longer a hyper carry than I'm really out of touch with things as  i thought that's supposed to be why you picked him.

Cait has always had a very strong late game because of her range and peel, but I wouldn't have considered her a hyper carry before the rework this preseason, since that made her scale better into the late game.

Riot keeps trying to say that Twitch is a hyper carry, but his damage scales comparatively poorly and his ult is lackluster relative to many other more updated champs. Originally his strength was being a strong laner who could roam for kills a team fights mid game, and honestly he never seemed to stand out as a late game champ. After they nerfed his stealth activation time he really dropped off as a late game champ.

Of course I could be wrong, but that's what I've seen and heard regarding those two.

In every game I've seen Twitch get close to or to full build he usually takes out 3ish ppl per fight unless hard focused or instagibbed. At least that's my experience with him. Though I think he needs a rework at this point because the only good ability he has is his ult. The passive has mostly negligible damage, stealth is never useful as am escape, w is a glorified slow and his e is almost always worse than Kalista's

All the last patch did was make Kog's early/mid a bit more of a threat and suddenly he's amazing.  He's not the strongest late game Marksmen, though.  That title probably goes to Vayne or Twitch.
